website_summaries.verdict: A basic beginner's guitar to test the lap steel waters.
pros: With its hardwood body, adjustable tone, included gig bag, and accompanying stand, this 6-string has nearly everything you need to get started playing
Features a single-coil pickup, chrome hardware, and stainless steel pickguard
cons: Some players find the single-coil pickup to be too noisy
Does not include a tone bar

customer_reviews.title: save up your money and buy something good, this isn't it
customer_reviews.text: requires major upgrades, won't stay in tune, upgrades would add around $200.00 to the price for $300.00 you could get a much better instrument and speaking of money these sell for $79.00 w/free shipping from guitar center and musicians friend $79.00 is more what they are worth and you can forget about free returns it's not sold or shipped by Amazon, don't spend all your time tuning instead of playing, save up your money and buy something GOOD and save the frustration unless you like to tune your guitar while you are playing it... I DON'T =(
customer_reviews.author: Marshall R.

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar kit at a very nice price!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a guitar connoisseur. This is his 17th guitar, and I must say - it has awesome sound! It's portable, and comes with a case, so it is great for him to tote around with it. It was a surprise gift for Easter, so I was worried, since he is so fanatical with his guitar quality, that he would think it was not great quality, but he really loves it! I really can't get over how great it sounded! I'm so proud of myself!
customer_reviews.author: gabs

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous cool looking bargain for beginner or intermediate lap steel player
customer_reviews.text: This lap steel guitar is perfect for me as a longtime guitarist, but a newbie to this instrument. It sounds really good, looks cool, is very sturdily built, and comes with a convenient screw-in 3-leg adjustable height stand. I paid twice as much more for a top-of-the-line Hilton Pro Guitar Limited Edition volume pedal, to get the best swell effect with it. (My pedal board's Boss volume pedal wasn't cutting it very well for this purpose.) I play to play it at times with my UU church band, once we get back to having in-person services someday. Looks like I'll have plenty of time to get competent on it, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner Level Lap Steel
customer_reviews.text: The guitar sounds good for a beginner's guitar. A lot smaller than I expected, but that doesn't take away from the playability of it. My only complaint is the sockets to which the legs screw in, one of them came stripped and the leg won't take. Its a simple fix if you have the ability to take the socket out and put the right size nut on the other side. Other than that it sounds good and plays smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Like the low price The tuning gears stripped out and ...
customer_reviews.text: Like the low price The tuning gears stripped out and had to buy new and new set of strings. Now i like it
customer_reviews.author: Gene E Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain. Replace strings ASAP
customer_reviews.text: For a hundred bucks you get a beautiful lap steel guitar, removable legs and a really nice gig bag. The guitar sounds great once you replace the cheap poorly installed strings. I still give it five stars since the guitar and gig bag are such a steel. Strings aren't too costly. I've bought two so far and recommended it to 3 others.
customer_reviews.author: Bayesian

customer_reviews.title: My wife enjoys it
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, I really have no complaints. If you're just learning lap steel and not sure if it's right for you, this is the one to get. Very sturdy, looks nice and plays well. The pickup output is a bit on the weak side, which can make it sound tinny unless you tweak your amp settings. Heavier gauge strings will help significantly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Rogue RLS=1 Lap Steel Guitar with Stand and Gig Bag Mettallic Blue
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat this guitar given it's price point! It came well packaged and setup was easy and precise. It was not tuned but that's understandable when shipping you don't want the strings tight. This unit plays like a much more expensive guitar. It has not buzzed or sounded tinny at all. It works well with both my amplifiers and produces a nice clear tone. The supplied legs are adjustable and make playing very comfortable. It also lends itself to many sounds through an effects pedal. I don't think anyone would not be satisfied with this lap steel!
customer_reviews.author: Skyeye

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive free advertisement. Solid guitar and sounds good.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my father. He was very happy with it and had it professionally tuned the next day. He plays it ar church in his wheelchair and had no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: 3fingerdirtdetector

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have searched more prior to purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to learn to play the steel guitar, and didn't want to make a huge investment. This product is of fair quality. I find it hard to keep in tune. Next time I purchase, I will do a bit more research before going for the less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great starter steel guitar
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to try, and this is a great starter steel guitar. Many hours of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner
customer_reviews.text: Item was real nice for a first lap steel,not a scratch on it, after adjustment, tuning and intonation,found that it sounded beautiful and easy to play,not as good as expensive models,as action is too high to permit fretting of notes(for the experienced player)dandy little guitar,very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Brauer

customer_reviews.title: HELPS TAKE UP TIME WHEN YOU ARE IN QUARENTINE
customer_reviews.text: SOUNDS BEAUTIFUL. LOVE THE COLOR AND I THINK IT IS A VERY GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN FOSTER

customer_reviews.title: Lap steel surprise
customer_reviews.text: Much better quality than I expected. Solidly built and should handle a lot of playing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fawlty out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the shipping boxes, which were both the size of a small room. Plugged into a 10 watt Fender practice amp, no sound. Then tried to attach the 3 legs and the center leg mount on the underside spit out 2 of the screws holding it in. Obviously I can't ship back to amazon but their server was Guitar Center. Can I bring it in to my local GC to get a fix?
customer_reviews.author: Craig Seufert

customer_reviews.title: Great little guitar for this price point!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle due to small size but big sound! Great value and really solid quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good little steel guitar but came with a chip in it
customer_reviews.author: SavannaGeorgia massengill

customer_reviews.title: Made a great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my fiance, he absolutely loves it. He's a beginner, and it's the perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: afershay

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas, he lives it!
customer_reviews.author: Betz

customer_reviews.title: Nice instrument.
customer_reviews.text: I Love The sound of this thing. Now I have to learn how to play it. BTW, You will also need a slide bar and an amp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, no tone bar
customer_reviews.text: Everything feels very durable and plays very nice but it doesn't come with a tone bar so you have to buy one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun playing
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this item wish it had a better stand
customer_reviews.author: Phantom Trucker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my grandson and he LOVES it !!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: strings uneven
customer_reviews.text: has a good tone and is playable but I had to even out the strings by cutting down the nut the #6 E string was set lower than all the other strings and I was having to really push down to prevent it from buzzing. After I lowered the other strings it played ok
customer_reviews.author: Razzle

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good sound
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the cost of this lap steel guitar. Looks good, solid "feel" for the fret board, good sound.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good bang-for-buck!
customer_reviews.text: This lap steel is pretty good value, especially for beginners. I would have liked the option to get better quality tuners and pickup, but overall I recommend this lap steel!
customer_reviews.author: VTrucker

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J. Virostko

customer_reviews.title: Wired backwards
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it didn’t work! Had to rewire the volume pot as it was wired backwards. Way to go South Korea
customer_reviews.author: David Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas gift for the Mr.
customer_reviews.text: This was what my husband asked for for Christmas. Was glad to find one reasonable priced, and it looks and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs!!!
customer_reviews.text: While not the best quality, it's perfect for our needs. Took it right to our music store for new strings and adjustments at the recommendation of my wife's teacher. Done this with all guitars I've purchased. Made an okay guitar into a great one. For a small price we get a great sound, and stays in tune! When a professional gives a thumbs up, you have to agree it's a great guitar for the price. Added a mid-range cost amplifier and we have nothing but praise for this product. Somewhere down the road we see a higher end product, but for now no complaints.. The removable legs are a little hard to install, that's why it didn't get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: larryk

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Fine
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this instrument. It's affordable and is a great lap steel for someone to start out on .
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice lap steel for the money. It has great sound and I'm sure my son will learn to play on it.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: very good, excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Hi. very good, excellent product, I recommend it to other people who are interested in this item, excellent price quality
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Henriquez

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level lapsteel
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely worth $110. I've been playing guitar for 30 years and always loved the sound of a lap steel. This is a perfect entry level instrument. And it comes with legs! I did pop a string trying to tune it. Not sure what gauge strings it comes with. I went to my local music shop and told them I'd like to play in open g and c6 and they gave me a set for each tuning. Worked great. Don't forget to order a tone bar if you buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Half of the screws were stripped. Will not tighten. Refuses to stay in tune. Save your money and your sanity. A true piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Fred D. Myres-McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made
customer_reviews.text: It has poor sound and that is even after I replaced the strings. In the process of trying to re-tune it, a string broke and I tried to replace it but the key head broke off. I then tried to replace the tuning key but the replacement parts did not work either. Looking for good replacement parts that will not break and will turn easy. The keys on this are very hard to turn even without strings on it.
customer_reviews.author: James Bills

customer_reviews.title: It'll do the job. Why spend more on an ...
customer_reviews.text: It'll do the job. Why spend more on an expensive lap steel or a pedal steel when you can sharpen your teeth on this for $99? Still, my buddy tripped and fell on it and the legs detached. I will have to repair it with some plastic wood and such.
customer_reviews.author: RiNohRaiRi

customer_reviews.title: Great Instrument!
customer_reviews.text: Big Bang for your buck! This steel guitar is a great value for the money! Looks great and sounds good, too. It comes with a little stand so we just keep it set up so it can be played whenever anyone wants to play!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Agne

customer_reviews.title: ... level instrument I think it will work out just great. No complaints
customer_reviews.text: For a beginners level instrument I think it will work out just great. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: michael mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little rig
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little rig, good to learn on, it seems true out of the box, I added a palm rest because I don't usually do palm muting, but that's my style. I just used an "ashtray" from a strat copy. With a little refining it works great.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rabideau

product_meta.title: Rogue RLS-1 Lap Steel Guitar with Stand and Gig Bag Metallic Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueRLS-1 Lap Steel Guitar with Stand and Gig Bag Metallic Blue. Slide into some classic country, Hawaiian, and blues tones with the affordable Rogue RLS1 Lap Steel Guitar. It features a hardwood body and neck with position markers, a single-coil pickup, volume and tone controls, chrome hardware, and a stainless steel pickguard. Includes gig bag and legs. Be sure to pick up a slide - we've got lots of cool models available!
feature_bullets: Produces classic country, Hawaiian, and blues tones Hardwood body Hardwood neck with position markers Single-coil pickup Volume and tone controls Chrome hardware Geared Tuners Single slant pickup Carry bag Includes 3 screw-in height-adjustable legs Stainless steel pickguard Includes legs
Slide into some classic country, Hawaiian, and blues tones with the affordable Rogue RLS1 Lap Steel Guitar
It features a hardwood body and neck with position markers, a single-coil pickup, volume and tone controls, chrome hardware, and a stainless steel pickguard
Be sure to pick up a slide - we've got lots of cool models available! Slide into some classic country, Hawaiian, and blues tones with the affordable Rogue RLS1 Lap Steel Guitar

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars117 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
